      • newConfigurationBuilder

        protected static CoreConfigurationBuilder<?> newConfigurationBuilder(Configuration seed)
        Create a configuration builder seeded from the given configuration.

        Calling build() on the returned builder will produce a functionally equivalent configuration to seed.

        Parameters:
        seed - configuration to duplicate
        Returns:
        a new configuration builder

      • updateCache

        public B updateCache(java.lang.String alias,
                     java.util.function.UnaryOperator<FluentCacheConfigurationBuilder<?,?,?>> update)
        Description copied from interface: FluentConfigurationBuilder
        Updates the configuration of the identified cache.

        If a cache exists for the given alias then the following process is performed:

        1. The configuration is converted to a builder seeded with that configuration.
        2. The builder is then transformed using the update unary operator.
        3. A new configuration is generated by calling build() on the resultant builder.
        4. The new configuration is associated with the given alias.
        If there is no cache associated with the given alias then an IllegalStateException will be thrown.
        Specified by:
        updateCache in interface FluentConfigurationBuilder<B extends CoreConfigurationBuilder<B>>
        Parameters:
        alias - cache alias
        update - configuration mutation function
        Returns:
        an updated builder
        See Also:
        FluentConfigurationBuilder.getCache(String), FluentConfigurationBuilder.withCache(String, CacheConfiguration), FluentConfigurationBuilder.withCache(String, Builder), FluentConfigurationBuilder.withoutCache(String), FluentConfigurationBuilder.updateCaches(UnaryOperator)

      • updateCaches

        public B updateCaches(java.util.function.UnaryOperator<FluentCacheConfigurationBuilder<?,?,?>> update)
        Description copied from interface: FluentConfigurationBuilder
        Updates the configuration of the all caches.

        For every existing cache the following process is performed:

        1. The configuration is converted to a builder seeded with that configuration.
        2. The builder is then transformed using the update unary operator.
        3. A new configuration is generated by calling build() on the resultant builder.
        4. The new configuration is associated with the given alias.
        Specified by:
        updateCaches in interface FluentConfigurationBuilder<B extends CoreConfigurationBuilder<B>>
        Parameters:
        update - configuration mutation function
        Returns:
        an updated builder
        See Also:
        FluentConfigurationBuilder.getCache(String), FluentConfigurationBuilder.withCache(String, CacheConfiguration), FluentConfigurationBuilder.withCache(String, Builder), FluentConfigurationBuilder.updateCache(String, UnaryOperator), FluentConfigurationBuilder.withoutCache(String)

      • withService

        public B withService(ServiceCreationConfiguration<?,?> config)
        Description copied from interface: FluentConfigurationBuilder
        Adds a service creation configuration to this configuration.

        This will remove any existing service creation configurations that are incompatible with the supplied one. This removal is equivalent to the following: 

         configurations.removeIf(
     existing -> !config.compatibleWith(existing) || !existing.compatibleWith(config)
 );
        Specified by:
        withService in interface FluentConfigurationBuilder<B extends CoreConfigurationBuilder<B>>
        Parameters:
        config - service creation configuration
        Returns:
        an updated builder
        See Also:
        ServiceCreationConfiguration.compatibleWith(ServiceCreationConfiguration), FluentConfigurationBuilder.getService(Class), FluentConfigurationBuilder.getServices(Class), FluentConfigurationBuilder.withService(Builder), FluentConfigurationBuilder.withoutServices(Class), FluentConfigurationBuilder.withoutServices(Class, Predicate), FluentConfigurationBuilder.updateServices(Class, UnaryOperator)

      • updateServices

        public <R,C extends ServiceCreationConfiguration<?,R>> B updateServices(java.lang.Class<C> clazz,
                                                                        java.util.function.UnaryOperator<R> update)
        Description copied from interface: FluentConfigurationBuilder
        Updates all service creation configurations of the given type.

        For each existing service creation configuration instance that is assignment compatible with clazz the following process is performed:

        1. The configuration is converted to its detached representations using the ServiceCreationConfiguration.derive() method.
        2. The detached representation is transformed using the update unary operator.
        3. A new configuration is generated by passing the transformed detached representation to the existing configurations ServiceCreationConfiguration.build(Object) method.
        4. The new configuration is added to the builders service configuration set.
        If there are no service creation configurations assignment compatible with clazz then an IllegalStateException will be thrown.
        Specified by:
        updateServices in interface FluentConfigurationBuilder<B extends CoreConfigurationBuilder<B>>
        Type Parameters:
        R - configuration detached representation type
        C - service configuration type
        Parameters:
        clazz - service creation configuration type
        update - configuration mutation function
        Returns:
        an updated builder
        See Also:
        FluentConfigurationBuilder.getService(Class), FluentConfigurationBuilder.getServices(Class), FluentConfigurationBuilder.withService(ServiceCreationConfiguration), FluentConfigurationBuilder.withService(Builder), FluentConfigurationBuilder.withoutServices(Class), FluentConfigurationBuilder.withoutServices(Class, Predicate)
